page.title: 14LOCAL CUSTOMS
page.content: On New Year's Day the children go singing from door to door for "CALENNIG".They wish the local people a happy new year,and in return they are given money.This is meant to bring luck.The local EISTEDDFOD held on the Friday nearest to St. David's Day at the Methodist chapel every year is a 110 years old.All the school children take part in the afternoon,and the adults in the evening.Sometimes it continues into the early hours of the morning.On St. David's Day all the elderly and other locals have "CAWL" at the school.A special service to commemorate those who lost their lives during the war is taken by the school on Armistice day,November 11th.by the war memorial.Carol singers can be heard one evening before Christmas every year.Â£70 was collected for heart research this year.
